vision_problem: Productivity tools force everyone into the same workflow, but high-performers have fundamentally different cognitive styles. A Myers-Briggs "TJ" type needs crisp, structured tasks while an "FP" type gets overwhelmed by that rigidity—yet both need to execute 50+ tasks/week without burning out.
vision_solution: AI that adapts to HOW you think, not just what you need to do. Context learns your personality-driven work style (structured vs. flexible, detail vs. big-picture) and translates tasks into YOUR language while protecting time for deep work and personal life.
vision_longterm: The assistant that knows you well enough to say "I notice you're avoiding this ambiguous task—should we break it into 3 concrete steps like you prefer?" or "This feels like too much structure—let's keep it high-level and trust your intuition."
mvp_aha: I want users to say: When Context automatically flagged that 'important but not urgent' project I'd been avoiding for 3 weeks—and suggested breaking it into the specific, structured steps I prefer—I actually started it. That's never happened with any other tool.
mvp_not_building: Mobile app, team features, time tracking
market_icp: Product managers, startup founders, and consultants (50+ tasks/week) who've tried Motion/Reclaim/Sunsama but found them too rigid or impersonal. They need AI that adapts to their cognitive style, not another one-size-fits-all system.
market_size: AM: $2.3B productivity software market (Statista 2024). SAM: 2M knowledge workers using premium task managers (Motion: 10K users, Reclaim: 50K). SOM: 1K users by year-end (0.05% of SAM) = $60K ARR at $5-15/mo [Needs to be verified]

market_moats: The more you use Context, the better it understands your cognitive patterns (Myers-Briggs type, work style preferences, decision-making heuristics). Motion optimizes for calendar constraints; Context optimizes for YOUR brain. This creates switching costs—you'd lose your 'AI work twin' if you left
status_tech_debt: Only one guy vibe coding the app, still has a lot of learning on deploying at scale and for multiple users
status_blockers: Most features are still being built - trying to figure out GTM strategy so that I know what MVP to build
business_value_prop: Save 1-2 hours/week on planning (for over-planners) - and encourage planning for those who don't. Reduce decision fatigue by 40%, complete 25% more 'important but not urgent' tasks that actually grow your career.
roadmap_post_mvp:
1. Mobile app (iOS/Android)
2. Personality type detection and adaptation (Myers-Briggs from task patterns)
3. Build context on users - what they do, people they work with, work style, and priorities.
roadmap_milestones: M1: Private beta (10 users), M2: Public beta (100 users), M3: Paid tier launch, M4: 1,000 DAU
tech_stack: Next.js 14 frontend, FastAPI backend, PostgreSQL + ChromaDB for task history + embeddings, LangGraph for AI orchestration (supports Ollama for privacy, OpenRouter for speed, and SOTA models for quality)
tech_ai_strategy: Local models are slow and all machines cannot run great but fast small models. Proposing OpenRouter for cheaper models and higher tiers for SOTA models (Claude, GPT, Gemini)
tech_privacy: User's tasks never leave their control. Compliance to be worked on.
gtm_tagline: The Personal assistant that works for you and with you, the way you do.
gtm_incentives: Early input on features, something new to try, perhaps tons of credits (making it free forever, if viable)
